message.content:
cs.IT, cs.LG, cs.DS, cs.NI, cs.SI. 

The paper deals with the problem of classifying data in a network, which involves communication between nodes. This suggests that the paper could belong to the Information Theory (cs.IT) or Networking and Internet Architecture (cs.NI) categories. The use of weights and thresholds in the classifier suggests that the paper could also belong to the Machine Learning (cs.LG) category. The analysis of the mean stopping time and comparisons with lower bounds suggest that the paper could belong to the Data Structures and Algorithms (cs.DS) category. Finally, the use of protocols and analysis of their communication cost suggests that the paper could belong to the Signal and Image Processing (cs.SI) category.
